Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk bacula-client
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: bacula bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated bacula packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Bacula is a set of programs that allow you to manage the backup, recovery, and verification of computer data across a network of different computers.
The bacula packages have been updated to ensure correct operation on Power little endian and ARM 64-bit hardware architectures. (BZ#1059611)
Notably, the bugs fixed by this update include:
* Previously, the length of bacula daemon names was limited to 30 characters and any additional characters were automatically truncated without displaying an error message. The truncated name was passed to other applications that, as a consequence, did not work as expected. With this update, the limit has been exceeded to 64 characters, so the length of the name is no longer cut. (BZ#1195625)
Users of bacula are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
